title: Ironmonger

fields.name: Abilities:
fields.value:
- At night, give a player a bucket. They will not be informed. You have 2 buckets.
- At night, choose a filled bucket to dump on a player, using every stored ability on the target. Gain necessary attributes from roles whose abilities you used.

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value:
- At the start of the night, if you have no buckets, you spend the night forging one.
- Players can only have one bucket. You cannot give buckets to players who you have stored buckets from.
- When a player with a bucket is visited by more than one player, you store every ability used on them that night inside the bucket. You will be informed that something was stored, but not what was stored.
- Your buckets are stored until used. They are labelled according to whose house they were placed at. (Ex: Deodat Lawson's Bucket)

fields.name: Background:
fields.value: - You start the game with a rusty bucket. On night 1, store every ability used against you inside the bucket, not learning what is stored. At night, you may splash the bucket on a player, using every ability stored within it, gaining necessary attributes from the roles whose abilities you used.

desc:
Post 4749
*My great, great grand-pap was a blacksmith. I like to think I take after him - but 'stead of swords I make shovels and buckets.*
